div.p: In an effort to proactively slow the spread of COVID-19, CCSP has announced that school will be CLOSED effective MARCH 16th until April 20th. We will continue to monitor the situation and advise you accordingly. Click here for updates

span.p: Please click on the link for information regarding Spring Break Click here for updates

span.strong: For COVID-19 & Parent Updates Click Here

a.span: #ChartersChangeLives Check out this amazing video that showcases the work of Paterson Charter Schools.

span.style: color: rgb(40, 40, 40); text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

span.span: The mission of the Community Charter School of Paterson is to inspire and empower its children, families and staff with opportunities to positively shape and transform their lives by becoming successful, life-long learners who possess critical thinking, academic, advocacy and leadership skills required to open new doors in their lives and the lives of others.
CCSP is one school located in three buildings.
75 Spruce Street houses the Kindergarten through Fourth grades, the Child Study Team, and the Business Office.
32 Spruce Street houses our Fifth grade located on the second floor.
137 Elison Street houses our middle school which is Sixth through Eight grades and is located directly behind City Hall.

h2.span: Excellence, Integrity, Dedication, Respect & Self-esteem, Success, and Partnerships.

span.span: The mission of the Community Charter School of Paterson identifies six characteristics that are important in life, not just in school.
